title: Access Violation Reading EXPLOITABLE_0228
vulnerability_information:
1	Basic info of application
1.1	Info of application
Application NamevVLC media player for Windows
Application Versionv4.0.0-dev Otto Chriek
Download Address:  http://nightlies.videolan.org/
Testing OS:  Windows 8

2	Info of test file
2.1	Test file info
Normal file name:	normal.mkv
Normal file type:  	MKV(Matroska file)
Normal file MD5:  	46D9C3E247FF3C528EBDF18C19F3458B
Crash file name:  	crash.mkv
Crash file type:  	MKV(Matroska file)
Crash file MD5:  	5CF35EEF33C024BF49A039A17D85A3AA

2.2	Crash file info
Replace a piece of data with 0x00 padding, from offset 0xfd41 to offset 0xfda4, the comparison of two files: diff.png.
 
Description of crash file:
Using MKVToolNix tool to parse the crash file, the mutation data triggering crash is located at:
Segment->Cluster->Simple Block->Frame section.
The Track Number equal to 2, indicating that this SimpleBlock is audio. And matroska does not have a detailed description of the mutated Frame data. (https://www.matroska.org/technical/specs/index.html#simpleblock_structure)。
 You can see it here: block.png, block-data.png.
 

3	Info of test
3.1	Description of test
Run VLC media player, try to play crash.mkv file, program crash and an error pop-up. 
3.2	Description of debug
Loading VLC debugging with WinDbg, below is the debug info and stack backtrace.
The key point to crash may be: libfaad_plugin+0x2b9d.
First chance exceptions are reported before any exception handling.
This exception may be expected and handled.
*** ERROR: Symbol file could not be found.  Defaulted to export symbols for C:\Program Files\VideoLAN\VLC\plugins\codec\libfaad_plugin.dll - 
*** ERROR: Symbol file could not be found.  Defaulted to export symbols for C:\Program Files\VideoLAN\VLC\libvlccore.dll - 
libfaad_plugin+0x2b9d:
000007f9`0fbf2b9d 47893499        mov     dword ptr [r9+r11*4],r14d ds:00000000`51d6c048=????????
0:030> kP
Child-SP          RetAddr           Call Site
00000000`5eebfb30 000007f9`12a0ca94 libfaad_plugin+0x2b9d
00000000`5eebfcc0 000007f9`12a0c888 libvlccore!input_Control+0x34a4
00000000`5eebfd10 000007f9`12a0cc94 libvlccore!input_Control+0x3298
00000000`5eebfdd0 000007f9`12a7acf6 libvlccore!input_Control+0x36a4
*** ERROR: Symbol file could not be found.  Defaulted to export symbols for C:\Windows\system32\msvcrt.dll - 
00000000`5eebfec0 000007f9`2810707b libvlccore!vlc_rand_bytes+0xa46
00000000`5eebff00 000007f9`28125e6d msvcrt!isspace+0x5b
*** ERROR: Symbol file could not be found.  Defaulted to export symbols for C:\Windows\system32\KERNEL32.DLL - 
00000000`5eebff30 000007f9`261b167e msvcrt!beginthreadex+0x13d
00000000`5eebff60 000007f9`28cfc3f1 KERNEL32!BaseThreadInitThunk+0x1a
00000000`5eebff90 00000000`00000000 ntdll!RtlUserThreadStart+0x21

4	File list
4.1	File list
Normal file:	normal.mkv
Crash file:	crash.mkv
comparison of two files:	diff.png
MKVToolNix:	block.png, block_data.png
Whole Windbg log:	 x64dug_info.txt


All files, logs are in the attachment, and the decompression password is：vL(@BwX2#ozZB

## Impact

This is not just a simple crash, it's possible to read or write memory data.
vulnerability_information_html:
1 Basic info of application
1.1 Info of application
Application NamevVLC media player for Windows
Application Versionv4.0.0-dev Otto Chriek
Download Address: http://nightlies.videolan.org/
Testing OS: Windows 8

2 Info of test file
2.1 Test file info
Normal file name: normal.mkv
Normal file type: MKV(Matroska file)
Normal file MD5: 46D9C3E247FF3C528EBDF18C19F3458B
Crash file name: crash.mkv
Crash file type: MKV(Matroska file)
Crash file MD5: 5CF35EEF33C024BF49A039A17D85A3AA

2.2 Crash file info
Replace a piece of data with 0x00 padding, from offset 0xfd41 to offset 0xfda4, the comparison of two files: diff.png.

Description of crash file:
Using MKVToolNix tool to parse the crash file, the mutation data triggering crash is located at:
Segment->Cluster->Simple Block->Frame section.
The Track Number equal to 2, indicating that this SimpleBlock is audio. And matroska does not have a detailed description of the mutated Frame data. (https://www.matroska.org/technical/specs/index.html#simpleblock_structure)%E3%80%82
You can see it here: block.png, block-data.png.

3 Info of test
3.1 Description of test
Run VLC media player, try to play crash.mkv file, program crash and an error pop-up.
3.2 Description of debug
Loading VLC debugging with WinDbg, below is the debug info and stack backtrace.
The key point to crash may be: libfaad_plugin+0x2b9d.
First chance exceptions are reported before any exception handling.
This exception may be expected and handled.

*** ERROR: Symbol file could not be found. Defaulted to export symbols for C:\Windows\system32\KERNEL32.DLL -

4 File list
4.1 File list
Normal file: normal.mkv
Crash file: crash.mkv
comparison of two files: diff.png
MKVToolNix: block.png, block_data.png
Whole Windbg log: x64dug_info.txt

All files, logs are in the attachment, and the decompression password is：vL(@BwX2#ozZB

Impact

This is not just a simple crash, it's possible to read or write memory data.

activities.message: Sorry for mistake, the Weakness should be Denial of Service.
activities.markdown_message: Sorry for mistake, the Weakness should be Denial of Service.

activities.message:
Hello @biewuxz,

Thank you for your submission! I was able to validate your report, and have submitted it to the appropriate remediation team for review. They will let us know the final ruling on this report, and when/if a fix will be implemented. Please note that the status and severity are subject to change.

Regards,
@nasr0x01
activities.markdown_message:
Hello @biewuxz,

Thank you for your submission! I was able to validate your report, and have submitted it to the appropriate remediation team for review. They will let us know the final ruling on this report, and when/if a fix will be implemented. Please note that the status and severity are subject to change.

Regards,
@nasr0x01

activities.message:
Today, I download the newest version of ‘nightlies’ from http://nightlies.videolan.org/. The file is vlc-4.0.0-20190304-0830-dev-win64.exe. and I try the crash.mkv again, then the vlc player crash.
Both the two OS: Windows 8 Enterprise Edition, Windows 10 professional edition.

Your patience is much appreciated.

Regards,
@nasr0x01

activities.message:
Hello @biewuxz,

Thank you for your report. This has been validated by the VLC team and will now be sent to the European Commission for final approval to pay out a bounty. We appreciate your patience and will update you as soon as we hear back but there may be some delay.

Regards,
@nasr0x01

Looking forward to further reply.

Thank you.

Regards,
@nasr0x01

activities.message:
Hello @biewuxz,

Thank you for this report. The team have confirmed your vulnerability as a Medium severity impact.

The H1 platform doesn’t allow €URO payments, hence the funky $1135.32 amount.

The USD$ conversion for today is 1 United States Dollar equals 0.88 Euro.

Thanks for your help and participating in this program.

Kind Regards
HackerOne
activities.markdown_message:
Hello @biewuxz,

Thank you for this report. The team have confirmed your vulnerability as a Medium severity impact.

The H1 platform doesn’t allow €URO payments, hence the funky $1135.32 amount.

The USD$ conversion for today is 1 United States Dollar equals 0.88 Euro.

Thanks for your help and participating in this program.

Kind Regards
HackerOne

activities.message:
Hello @nasr0x01,
I have questions about request a CVE ID:
1, What time will the fix is published? Will I be notified?
2, Do I need to submit a request for CVE ID by myself? (at https://cveform.mitre.org/)
3, After that, how long will CVE request be accepted?

activities.message:
Hello @biewuxz,

I just received a reply from VLC's internal team, although they won't be able to request a CVE, you can do it yourself at the link I provided previously.

Regarding the release date, hopefully within a week after the program completes but they might be some delays though.

I hope this answers your questions.

Regards,
@nasr0x01

activities.message:
Hi @biewuxz, 

We have received a notification from the VLC team that this is confirmed to be fixed in 3.0.7 thus determined that this issue is now resolved. If you’re still able to reproduce this issue then, please let us know and we will investigate further. 

Thanks!
@nasr0x01

activities.message: hi @nasr0x01, accroding to the Participating CNAs of CVE(http://cve.mitre.org/cve/request_id.html#cna_participants), Bug Bounty Programs from HackerOne is listed in. I had wrote an email on 25 June to support@hackerone.com to request a CVE ID for my report, but I have not recived any replies. Any updates yet? Thanks.

activities.message:
hi @nasr0x01, I contacted the CVE team today. For this CVE request from hackerone, CVE official let me refer to this report: https://hackerone.com/reports/484398. So could you please request CVE ID for this report?
Thanks.
